text:
Boston announces 2017 spring tour of North America By: Robert Rheubottom AXS Contributor Feb 14, 2017 1 day ago 85 85 16541761 6 y2017m02d14 114602 YouTube 
Boston fans can across the U.S. and Canada can look forward to seeing the band back on the road in 2017. The “More Than a Feeling” hitmakers have announced the first 10 dates of their newly announced 48-city Hyper Space Tour. 
The multi-platinum sellers unveiled the news on Feb. 13 via an update at their official Facebook page. The Hyper Space Tour will follow up Boston's highly successful 40th Anniversary Tour of 2016 and will initially hit markets across the southern U.S. throughout April. 
The spring romp begins April 14 in Hollywood, Fla., at Hard Rock Live . The veteran Beantown rockers will make multiple stops across Florida, Louisiana and Arkansas, before wrapping up April 26 in North Little Rock, Ark., at Verizon Arena . More dates are expected to be announced in the coming weeks. 
Select presales will begin Feb. 14 at 10:00 a.m. local time. Tickets go on sale to the public starting Feb. 17 at 10:00 a.m. local time. For more information, click here . 
Boston continue to be led by founding member Tom Scholz (lead guitar, keyboards). The current line up includes: Gary Pihl (rhythm guitar, keyboards), Curly Smith (drums, percussion, harmonica), Jeff Neal (drums, percussion), Tommy DeCarlo (lead vocals, keyboard, percussion), Tracy Ferrie (bass, backing vocals ) and Beth Cohen (keyboards, guitar). 
Boston's recent setlists have featured a cross section of their numerous greatest hits and beloved album tracks, spanning their storied four-decade career. Fans can expect to hear songs dating back to their 1976 self-titled debut album, including classics like “Peace of Mind," "Rock and Roll Band," "Smokin'," "Don't Look Back" and "Amanda.” 
Scholtz and company wrapped up their 2016 tour schedule in celebration of their 40th anniversary with a hometown two-night stand Aug. 14 and Aug. 15 in Boston at Wang Theatre . Their most recent studio album is 2013's Life, Love & Hope , which was their sixth studio effort and follow up to 2002's Corporate America . 
See below for Boston's initial 2017 North American tour dates. Tickets for select events are available at AXS . For all the latest information on Boston, click here .
